results.title: France to Offer Free Contraception for Women Up to 25
results.abstract: The government, responding to what it said was a decline in the use of contraceptives among some young women because of the cost, will pay for contraception starting next year.

results.title: Africa’s C.D.C. director urges wealthy nations to forego Covid vaccine boosters and donate them instead.
results.abstract: The World Health Organization asked wealthy countries to hold off on administering booster shots for healthy patients until at least the end of the year as a way of enabling every country to vaccinate at least 40 percent of their populations.

results.title: South Korea’s surge in Covid cases threatens its plans for reopening.
results.abstract: Cases have remained high even as vaccinations expand. Health officials say more people are ignoring social distancing rules as pandemic fatigue accumulates.

multimedia.caption: A Covid-19 testing site in Seoul last week. The metropolitan area has more than half South Korea’s population, and 75 percent of its recent virus cases.
multimedia.copyright: Ahn Young-Joon/Associated Press

results.title: Trial Begins Over November 2015 Paris Terrorist Attacks
results.abstract: The assaults carried out by Islamic State extremists that killed 130 people deeply rattled France and sent shock waves across Europe. The proceedings are scheduled to last at least nine months.
org_facet: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

results.title: ‘This Is the Biden Agenda’
results.abstract: The sprint for President Biden’s signature legislative plan has begun.
